clinical_study.brief_title: Motor Excitability Study of High Definition Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (HD-tDCS) in Chronic Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Motor Excitability Study of High Definition Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (HD-tDCS) in Chronic Stroke

brief_summary.textblock: High definition tDCS will be conducted to both stroke and healthy subjects on primary motor cortex area to explore the motor excitability changes before and after stimulation.

primary_outcome.description: It is used to investigate the changes in corticomuscular coherence for studying connectivity between the brainwave using EEG and the affected hand muscles using EMG
The ARAT is a 19-item measure divided into 4 sub-tests (grasp, grip, pinch, and gross arm movement) to assess upper limb functioning

secondary_outcome.description: It is used to evaluate and measure upper-limb recovery in post-stroke hemiplegic patients, and items are scored on a 3-point ordinal scale
It is used to identify neural correlates of stimulation-induced behavioral gains for investigating tDCS-induced changes in brain activations
It is used to measure the changes in interhemispheric imbalance and corticospinal excitability

arm_group.description: The center anode is fixed on the ipsilesional primary motor cortex and the 4 surrounding cathode electrodes will be placed about 6 cm to the center.
The center cathode is fixed on the contralesional primary motor cortex and the 4 surrounding anode electrodes will be placed about 6 cm to the center.

intervention.description: Different stimulation protocols will be applied to the primary motor cortex of stroke patients
